column4: so i just upgraded to dapper....now my touch pad is extremely sensitive and it's buttons barely work?
activate SHMConfig in xorg.conf and troubleshoot with synclient

in /etc/X11/xorg.conf there's a device section for your touchpad. You need to add the option SHMConfig and the value "on". Then restart X. Then use the command line tool synclient -l and troubleshoot from there.
go to the synaptic device section
add an option line "SMHConfig" with the value "on"
then save the file, and restart X.
do you have knowledge of ifconfig and iwconfig ?
in the graphical config tool, does eth2 show up as wireless or ethernet ?
did you set the essid, an ip address etc for eth2 ?
maybe you need to deactivate eth1 before you can activate eth2.. I'm not sure.
it will say activation interface eth2 and it will say active but it doesnt appear to have a connection.
